title: Dracula: The Voyage of the Demeter by Robert Forrest - BBC Horro
description:
THE VOYAGE OF THE DEMETER by Robert Forrest.

In Bram Stoker&#039;s novel Dracula, the infamous vampire count arrives in England in 1897 on a ship, the Demeter, which has sailed from Varna in Bulgaria to Whitby. Stoker tells the story of the voyage in only five short pages of the Captain&#039;s log, which becomes increasingly disjointed and garbled, as though the Captain had been seized by some kind of mania. This dark, gothic play imagines the full story of the Demeter&#039;s nightmare voyage.

When the play begins, the Demeter is already a troubled ship - two men have mysteriously disappeared - and, as the voyage continues, more men vanish.

There are reports of a stranger, a tall, pale gentleman, having been seen on deck at night. When the ship finally reaches port, only one man is found on board: the Captain. His hands bound to the wheel and clutching a crucifix, he is already dead as the ship comes into harbour.

Ripelski ...... Finlay Welsh
Robash ...... Gary Lewis
Kanesky ...... Steven McNicoll
Bretov ...... Grant O&#039;Rourke
Gentleman ...... Alexander Morton

Producer Patrick Rayner.

1 Hour.

First broadcast on BBC Radio Four, 23rd Feb 2008.

My recording at 160kbps CBR joint-stereo mp3.
